Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: First, I really love the tablet. I've spent hours and hours on in the past month. I'm on it every day for at least two hours.Here's the but ... for the things I use it for it isn't significantly better than the kindle fire hd that Best Buy sells for $125.  That's not saying I didn't get my money's worth with the HDX, it just shows what a great deal the cheaper model is.
Reviews.Title: well worth every penny, but.....

Reviews.Author: R. Allemann
Reviews.Content: First of all, I am a long time Apple Fan. I own a Mac Desktop, an iPad and an iPhone. I like to use my phone strictly for phone-related uses--making calls, using the map while traveling---that sort of thing. It is just too small for watching movies, playing games and such. But I wanted a small 4G LTE tablet of some sort that was light and would easily slip inside my purse. I wanted one that I could take with me when I traveled out of town, made road trips with my hubby, or when I'm killing time waiting for my son at his music lessons. My iPad is full-size and connected to a keyboard case, so I didn't want to keep lugging that around. So, since I am an Amazon Prime member, and after much thought and research, I finally decided on the Kindle Fire HDX 7".At first I was concerned that I might not like it. One thing I don't care for as an Apple user is how restricted their apps are and how geared they are toward all things Apple. I was afraid that I might be repeating myself by buying a Kindle---that this tablet might be locked up in all things Amazon with no access to Google apps, youTube, Gmail, Chrome, or other apps that might not be available in the Amazon app store. However, I've found that the Kindle Fire is not locked up after all. I learned that even though there are some really great apps in the Amazon store, not everything is there that I might like or want. Yet, it was very easy to install a third party app called 1MobileMarket, and with that I have been able to side-load apps that I can't find in the Amazon app store. One app I was abler to download for example is Chrome, which of course is a Google app. It works great! I was able to sign in on Chrome with my Google account and watch all the youTube playlists and favorites that I had accumulated in my Google youTube account. I was also able to earmark Google as my search engine of choice on the Silk browser. In the Kindle email app, I was able to incorporate both my Hotmail and my Gmail accounts, and it handles both of them seamlessly. While I'm on the subject of side loading, another app that you might want to download right off the bat is the free app ES File Explorer. It's a full-featured file and app manager which is similar to Finder on a Mac or Windows Explorer on a PC. It's been really valuable in helping me find and organize apps and games, etc. after I've side-loaded them to my kindle. I highly recommend this app before you get started with side loading.Now on to my music collection. I have a ton of songs that I've already placed in my iTunes account and I didn't want to have to buy them again in order to listen to them on my Kindle. So by using the (free) Amazon Cloud Player and the (free) Amazon Music Importer, I was able to upload all the music that I had put in my iTunes account to the Amazon Cloud. The next time I turned on my Kindle Fire HDX, then went to Music, there were all my songs right there for me to listen to and/or download to my Kindle. I then found a really great feature within the Music app. It is called x-ray. I found it by accidentally pressing it as I was listening to a Diana Krall song. While I was listening to the song, and when I pressed the x-ray icon, up on the screen came the lyrics to the song, following along with Ms. Krall as she sang (similar to karaoke words streaming on the screen). When the next song came on, the lyrics to that song came up on the screen. Cool! The sound is amazingly strong for such a small tablet! As is the video display. And speaking of videos, I have several instant videos that I've purchased on Amazon, and they display and sound beautifully on the Kindle Fire HDX! I also have several videos on my Mac computer, and by using the free app Android File Transfer which I had downloaded onto my Mac, I was able to connect my Kindle to my Mac with the USB cord, and simply upload those videos to the Kindle library storage.Day by day I'm learning more and more about my Kindle and how fun and easy it is to use. But on the second day after I had bought it, I ran into a problem while trying to get into the app store. I couldn't figure out how what to do, because I couldn't get the App store to open. I just kept getting a black screen. So I pulled down the Kindle menu from the top, found and pressed the Mayday feature and within a matter of seconds, a young man with headphones on popped up on the screen and asked in a friendly voice, "Hello! How may I help you?" I told him the problem, and then watched my screen in amazement as he opened the necessary screen, forced closed an app, and then got me into the app store. Within moments he fixed the problem right before my eyes. So impressive! (By the way, although you can see them, they can't see you---in case you're wondering)One problem that some have mentioned, is the blue/purple haze around the edges of the screen when one is reading an ebook on this Kindle. Yes, I guess it is there, now that I looked for it. But I really don't find it to be a distraction, because it is very slight. However, you have three different page color settings to choose from that might help if this really bothers you. You can choose to have your book pages be white with black letters, sepia pages with brownish-black lettering, or black pages with white letters. Since I prefer the black pages/white letters setting (as I mostly read at night), the faint purple haze around the edges of the book pages aren't an issue for me because it simply doesn't show at all under the black color. Speaking of the eBooks section, many (most?) of the books have a feature on them called Text to Speech. While reading a book, you simply tap on the Play icon, and the book becomes an audio book, and you can listen as the book is read to you while you go about doing other things.So to summarize, I am a long time faithful Apple user, but I have to say that I am really liking my new Kindle Fire HDX. Don't let the negative reviews keep you from trying this little amazing tablet out for yourself. For all the "problems" that I've seen mentioned here and there, there's none that are really an issue (in my humble opinion) as you get to know your Kindle Fire. I can honestly say that the more I learn about this little tablet and all the wonderful things it can do, the happier I am that I took the plunge and bought it!
Reviews.Title: This Apple user loves the Kindle Fire HDX!

Reviews.Author: asortafairytale
Reviews.Content: I bought this about a month ago and wanted to give myself some time to play around with it before writing this review.Let me just say, I'm really enjoying it. It's the first tablet I've ever owned, so I can't compare it to anything else, but I am really enjoying this little toy. I've downloaded and listened to a couple of audio books while driving to and from work. I'm addicted to a few game apps that are eating up WAY more time than they should, but that's what they're for, right? I also have the Weather Channel app that I check each morning before I get ready for work.One of my absolute favorite features is the quality of the screen. I have the Netflix and Hulu apps and the screen is so freaking amazing. So crisp and clear. Honestly, it's better than the screen on my laptop. I still use my laptop for laptopy things - creating Word and Excel documents, or going online if I need to have multiple browser windows or tabs open/do multiple things at once. But if I just want to sit and watch a video, I prefer this Kindle over my laptop.I've also read a couple of books on it. Not my favorite, to be honest. I'm not a huge fan of reading on a backlit screen. I have a Kindle Keyboard that I much prefer reading on. But this isn't too bad and I enjoy it more than I thought I would.I definitely recommend this Kindle and can't wait to continue using it for a long time.
Reviews.Title: My new favorite toy

Reviews.Author: HAMPOTIN
Reviews.Content: Let start by saying I am a Huge fan of Amazon and Kindle.i have the Kindle reader which is fantastic.but the Hdx7 was a shocking disappointment.I had to call Kindle on mayday every other day to reboot this unit to get it to work.after five days of this I sent it back,and as usual amazon was great with the return process. To bad the bugs on this were not worked out before it,s release.
Reviews.Title: Disappointed with hdx7

Reviews.Author: Wasana Sriprachya-anunt
Reviews.Content: I really liked it at first since the screen resolution made everything so clear, but then a few problem emerged. First, the wifi sometimes disconnects out of the blue and I would have to turn it off and on again. Second, my email account sometimes has a problem updating. When this happens with the HDX, it always works fine on my iphone. Third, having only the front camera, I thought that's fine since I was going to use it to skype video with my family, but the chat always have echoes. Again, I've never had this problem with my iphone or Mac. Now I really regret buying it. I should have just bought the iPad, even the older version of the iPad would be better than this new HDX.
Reviews.Title: Regret buying it

Reviews.Author: Nevermore
Reviews.Content: *Note--Review addresses some common concerns*An ebook reader I thought...Something to read a few books, maybe watch a movie, possibly play a couple games on a bigger screen than my phone. Something that looked nice, didn't cost too much, and had some good reviews. I had no idea this sleek,little, black tablet would become one of my favorite electronic items in the house.I had used a relative's older Kindle HD off and on, so thought I had an idea about speed and what to expect.  Nope, wrong.  The new 2.2GHz Quad-core Snapdragon processor is blazing fast.  Tapping on an app, and it opening, is near instant, HD movies play seamlessly with stutter and pixelation being an extreme rarity. Web pages load quickly, and the touch-screen is responsive, yet not so sensitive you will accidentally open an app by brushing against it's icon.The button placement and size, to me, are ideal.  With the older Kindle, it was easy to think you are pressing volume, but would be pressing on/off.  Not to mention they were tiny. The power button and the volume buttons are on opposite sides on the HDX. Mine is in a case, and neither button has accidentally been depressed.If you are looking for a gorgeous screen with vivid detail and color, the Kindle HDX is impressive.  The 1920x1200 display handles HD content with ease, ebooks are crisp and clear; it really is stunning. Additionally, the black level rendering is superb for such a small unit. Brightness can be set manually or you can let the Kindle adjust it automatically based on lighting conditions.Located on the back are two speakers and there is also a mini-jack in case you want to use headphones.  For as thin as the HDX is, the sound quality is good.  While the speakers cannot compare to a Home Theater, they reproduce sound clearly and with little to no distortion, even at maximum volume.Battery life has been more than adequate for my needs, yet I have noticed that how long it lasts can vary depending on usage.  For example, I started off with the battery at 100% and streamed movies for four hours straight; it was at 70% at the end.  Conversely, I played a popular game on it for 30 minutes, and the battery went from 100% to 82%.  Every time I play it, I know to expect a 10% draw in about 15 minutes.  Also, any app that uses a lot of memory or constantly runs in the background can affect battery life.  A Memory Manager can help turn off apps in the background and prolong the battery.My normal usage consists of heavy email, medium amounts of web surfing, lots of reading, and a few hours of streaming, mirrored to the TV.  Adding it all together probably equals between 3-6 hours per day.  The lowest the level has been was 33%, and that was after using all day and forgetting to plug in at night, so it stayed in sleep mode until the next day.Below I will address some concerns that seem to be common:1.  Dropped or poor WiFi Signal-- I have had this happen only three times in three months of ownership.  Once, was due to the router needing to be "flushed." The second time, I cleared the cache in the Kindle, and the third time I have no explanation, but a simple rebooting of the HDX fixed the issue.2. Blue glow around the edges-- If I had not read about this, I would never have noticed it.  The only time it is visible is on an all white background, such as an ebook.  However, to me it is very faint and neglible unless you are focusing solely on the edges.  It is due to the edge lighting using the blue LED's and using the auto-brightness or manual adjustments should minimize impact.3. Screen Flicker-- This does happen on occasion, yet only with certain memory and color-intensive apps.  Every time it has self-corrected within a short period, and have never experienced it when streaming a video or movie.4. Ads-- I did not pay extra for no ads, but do not see them as a problem.  They only appear on the lock screen and do not interfere with performance.  Additionally, you can view them all on one page and sometimes a special buy will show.  If you absolutely do not want ads, the payable option exists.5. Laggy/Slow performance-- As with any computer device, the cache can become full and should be cleaned regularly.  Anytime my Kindle HDX seemed slow, a simple cleaning remedied the issue.  One note--certain apps can affect performance and I recommend checking after installing various apps to see if they hinder the device. The cleaner I use is Clean Master and it also acts as a memory manager.6. No Google Play--It is true that you cannot download from Google Play, however, there are other reputable android sites that you can use.  Youtube and the Web have plenty of resources to help.  You will need a File Manager, which can be obtained in the Kindle Store for free.  I use File Manager Free along with 1MobileMarket for any android apps not available in the Kindle Store yet.7. No Youtube-- I use Youtube all of the time on my HDX, whether through Silk or through the app on my Bluray Player.Some other Features and Benefits:1. I have three email accounts synced with my Kindle HDX.  It makes it very easy and convenient to turn it on and have instant access to all of them at once.2. For me, it is preferable to not use the carousel.  I appreciate that I can just swipe upwards and have all the apps I put on my home page arranged cleanly just like desktop icons.  Additionally, by holding an app and dragging it to another you can create "folders" to customize the appearance.  For example, have all your games in one  folder icon, all of your productivity apps in another, and so on.3. My Kindle HDX can control two cable boxes, my bluray player, my AV Receiver, act as an independent cable box, stream movies with Amazon Prime and Cable On-Demand.  Once the Home Theater is on, all I need is the Kindle to control all of it.4. Using the Netgear PTV3000, an app, and the Kindle HDX has eliminated the need for me to have a cable box for each TV.5. As time goes on, I keep finding more uses for the HDX.  It is amazing how much this small tablet can do at a fraction of the cost of others.6. It is an incredible e-book reader and library.  I love how convenient it is to have so many books in one place and be able to take them wherever I go.The Kindle HDX has become the most-used computer in the house. It does everything I initially wanted and much more and is still working great after three months. If you are looking for an incredible value in a tablet, then I definitely recommend it.  Currently, it is my favorite purchase from Amazon.
Reviews.Title: Much more than a simple e-book reader...I love it!

Reviews.Author: Lee Harpster
Reviews.Content: Got the new Kindle Fire HDX 7" as a Christmas gift and I love it! WAY better than any other tablet I've tried recently. I had a situation with my speaker, so I used the MAYDAY. TIM (it's too bad I don't know his last name) went above and beyond to help me. I told him that I couldn't hear him, so he started writing messages to me on paper then holding them up in front of the camera for me to read! He wrote to me that I should simply do a restart of the Kindle. I did and the sound issue was resolved! I asked him if he had ever helped anyone else this way; he wrote that "We were making history!" LOL. So my review for the Kindle HDX and MAYDAY is  2 thumbs up all the way!
Reviews.Title: Awesome display and sound. MAYDAY is fantastic!

Reviews.Author: Bradley Powers
Reviews.Content: First time ever writing a review on Amazon.  The Kindle Fire HDX is a giant leap forward for the Kindle.  I have had both the original Fire and the Fire HD.  Both of those were ok, but no where near an iPad in my opinion.  But with the Kindle Fire HDX Amazon has not only caught the iPad but passed it.  The screen is amazing, the HDX is so much faster and Silk is amazingly quick.  A low price and great value for a snappy, elegant tablet.
Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire HDX

Reviews.Author: Joyce B
Reviews.Content: This is my first Kindle and I am very happy with it.  I have looked at them for a long time and wanted one when the first `Fire' came out but just kept putting it off.  When I finally decided to take the plunge and get one I had heard there was a new updated one about to be released and waited for the newest version.I've had it now for a week. It's a great little tablet at a great price. It is slim, light weight and looks great!  The screen is beautiful, great picture quality and the processor is very fast.  Mine was almost fully charged when I received it, so I basically just had to pull it out of the box turn it on and `GO'.  It was already registered through Amazon. It seemed to do a quick little update and all was set.  Plus it is great it came with a quick charger adaptor, as it seemed all the previous versions never did.At the moment I mainly will use it for reading books, playing some games and occasional internet use. I like all the other options of things you can do with it, even if I don't think I need it at the moment.  At this point I am not sure if I will use it for streaming movies as it sounds many like to do. It's nice to have the option to do it. Maybe in time I will look at doing that and give up most of the movie channels I pay for on my cable tv.Some are complaining about a purple haze border around edge of screen.  I can see that now, but to be honest, I had to go looking for it after I read it in the reviews.  It is not very noticeable to me.  I just don't see it as a big deal and  I wouldn't consider this such a major flaw to give it a negative review or send it back.  It is a faint, and I mean faint, haze.  I guess my opinion is it is not a deal breaker for me.  Everyone has different expectations for things.For me this was a five star purchase at this price point.
Reviews.Title: Very Happy& Impressed With It - For the price you can't go wrong

Reviews.Author: Oz resident
Reviews.Content: I'm going through chemotherapy, so I bought this to give me something to do while sitting for hours receiving my poison, waiting for appointments, or vegging in the hospital. I've only had it for about three weeks, but so far, it has preformed well. My only complaint is the Silk browser that comes with it does not support flash. I installed the Dolphin browser, and all is well. Very pleased.
Reviews.Title: My chemo companion.

Reviews.Author: Tech Junkie
Reviews.Content: Great Tablet but REALLY needs Google Store, better quality control, and some better design choices. Will be returning the tablet to try the Nexus 7 or just go and buy a Mini 2/Air.I'll keep it short and easy to read and list the pros and cons as bullet points (I was hesitating between a 2 or 3 but I think Amazon is on the right track so 3 stars):Pros:1- Very clear and beautiful 1920X1200 resolution screen (A bit higher resolution than 1080p which is 1920X1080). Even better than your HDTV since it's this high of resolution on a smaller size (higher PPI)2- Excellent speaker volume and location. Doesn't get blocked when using the hdx in landscape mode (the iPad and Nexus 7 have the speaker placement issue)3- Mayday is actually very useful for someone that isn't tech savy. I was able to get connected every time I tested it within 10-15seconds. I would assume the wait will be longer during holiday season.Cons:1- The first and biggest issue for this and any tablet is APP selection. This one is missing many of the latest and greatest apps that are on the Apple App store and Google Play (including Time Warner App, some banking apps, big mobile games)etc...The Amazon app store is currently estimated at 75000 apps while both the Apple and Google App stores are each over 1 million apps and have many dedicated specifically to the tablet (specially the Apple App Store)2- Buttons placement of On/Off button and volume Up/Down are horrible and size is way too small for my normal sized hands.3- Although it is smoother than the last Samsung Tab 2 I've used, the interface still feels a bit clunky at times. It's not butter smooth like the IOS on the iPad (believe me, even my iPad 1 was smoother than this)4- Apps crashed too frequently, even when going in the prebuilt Shopping and App store apps5- Needs better quality control. I understand this is probably the first batch of the tablets and usually every first few batch of a gadget have some issues but I really think better quality control would alleviate most if not all issues. My HDX has some screen flashing as if the backlight is getting adjusted up and down consistently. Also, I have a dead pixel that is quite noticeable in the middle right side of the screen.
Reviews.Title: Honest Review from a Tech Junkie

Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from the Kindle reader 2nd generation to the HDX 7 - I truly enjoyed and used my kindle reader.  However, after spending about ten minutes with the HDX 7 I knew I made the right choice.  I'm a senior citizen who loves electronics and love the world of electronics.  For the seniors that sometime shy away from electronics this is for you.  You will find in just a few minutes you will be able to use all the functions of the HDX 7 with ease.  I do suggest a stylus, case and screen protector (in my other reviews).  I had to use the MAYDAY feature - I didn't need it I just wanted to try it - what a great feature and simple to use.  To me this is a item I will use everyday.  Also a piece of information you can run the battery to 0 with perfect play before it stops.  I believe whichever size you buy you will enjoy!
Reviews.Title: An electronic product for all ages

Reviews.Author: Michael J
Reviews.Content: I've bought a number of tablets over the years. My first was a Samsung Galaxy 7.5. Although it's old tech now, one thing I love about Samsung products is they LAST. My next was an iPad 2 and then a Microsoft Surface Pro. This Kindle Fire HDX is the first kindle I've owned personally, although I've gotten to borrow Kindles from others (originals and Paperwhite). This is, to date, the BEST tablet I've ever used. It's fast, responsive and never seems to drop the connection. I haven't gotten to use a 3G feature yet, but this tablet finds a WiFi connection where my Surface Pro, other tablets and even my powerful laptops can't get it.It's got great apps, the screen is stunning (looks better than the last iPad Air or Surface Pro 2), and its drop test rating is one of the better ones. Plus, I understand that Amazon is now offering an interest-free payment plan for the HDX. I'm very happy to have made this purchase and if Amazon continues to build tablets like these I fully believe they are going to leave all of their competitors behind.
Reviews.Title: I.Love.This.

Reviews.Author: booklvr70
Reviews.Content: My new Kindle Fire HDX arrived today exactly as promised.  After reading so many unsatisfied reviews, I was quite skeptical about its operation.  Well, was I ever surprised!  The Kindle arrived perfectly boxed and in great condition.  Set-up was as easy as pie; no trouble connecting to wifi; in fact, no trouble at all.  I am a 71-year old great grandmother who has absolutely NO experience with a Kindle.  So, if I can do it, so can you.  I am a voracious reader and was anxious to see the "blue haze" so many people talked about.  Personally, I cannot understand the complaints.  Yes, there is a very faint blue border, but not enough to bother mentioning (to me).  I am absolutely astounded at what this device is capable of.  I spent several hours experimenting and I realize there will be a learning curve, but I'm having fun with it.  I've used a Nook for the last two years and have slowly grown discontented with its performance.  When placed side-by-side, the Kindle wins in weight, brightness, speed and features.  I look forward to many happy hours with my new "playmate."  Did I mention how great the colors are and how vivid the videos?  My recommendation is to buy this Kindle and examine it for yourself; I have absolutely no regrets!  Enjoy!
Reviews.Title: Greatest invention since the napkin!

Reviews.Author: Andy Lee
Reviews.Content: Let me just start by saying this is the first tablet I ever owned; however, I am very familiar with its hardware components enough to say that this is a very powerful tablet. I've used others in the past, and I never could get past how slow they operate; however, Kindle Fire HDX is an exception. While I'm not familiar with other operating systems, I will say that Fire OS is very smooth. I will admit there were some bugs while working the device. For instance, I have run into a few occasions where it has crashed and restarted. I have also run into situations where I've had to reinstall apps for them to work properly again. In time, I'm sure they'll fix these issues with updates.With respect to the apps that are available for this tablet, you'll might be disappointed. I'm more of a gamer, so going onto Amazon to find out that some of the apps I wanted aren't available to the Kindle yet. This is rather unfortunate, considering a number of these apps have been out for quite some time already. Basically, Amazon doesn't have the same broad selection you would typically find in the Apple Appstore or Google Play. Though it might be common knowledge, apps from the Appstore or Google Play aren't compatible with the Kindle. On the plus side, Amazon does release a free app each day, so that makes developing your collection easier.I've also tested some of the new features that came with the Fire OS 3.1 upgrade, including second screen and Miracast. Second screen allows you to take movies and TV shows from Amazon, and lets you play your selection wirelessly on a nearby television, assuming you have either a Playstation 3 or 2013 Samsung TVs connected. Bear in mind that second screen is only available to amazon content, nothing from netflix, hulu, or any other online streaming services. Ironically, TV Sideview (Sony's app that allows you to control Sony devices from your tablet, including the PS3) isn't compatible w/ the Kindle either. As a result, you'll have to navigate your system on both your controller and the Kindle, at least until, and this is assuming, TV Sideview becomes available for the Kindle.Miracast is a much better version of Second Screen, as this allows you to wirelessly display what you're doing on your kindle onto a nearby television or media streaming device, as long as it is Miracast compatible and compatible with your Kindle. For those of you who have familiarized yourself with Chromecast, just a heads up: it's not compatible with the Kindle. I ended up using the NETGEAR Push2TV Wireless Display HDMI Adapter - Miracast and WiDi (PTV3000) (link provided below) to test Miracast, and I have to say that if you want to use your Kindle to stream content onto your TV, this is the way to go. It displays in HD, the sound quality is superb, and anything you do on your kindle can be placed on your TV. **Gamers, if you're expecting to play games in this fashion, bear in mind that there is likely going to be lag time between the commands you input into the tablet and the miracast compatible device. This doesn't affect anything other than games, however, as the sound and video output on your TV will be synchronized during use. Thus, if you want responsive controls, I don't recommend miracast for gamers.There was one more update that came with Fire OS 3.1, and that is Goodreads. Unfortunately, I'm not too familiar with it. All I know is that it's an amazon app that allows you to share what you've read, provide recommendations, and look at what your friends and other people are reading. Readers, you'll probably find this resourceful. I know some of my friends love it.Overall, the Kindle has the power and graphics to provide you with a great quality experience; however, the selection of apps do pale in comparison to other devices. While it's not perfect, it still provides the same functions you would find in other tablets (some of which are better). If you have to have all of the latest apps, especially the ones that accompany big games, such as GTA V and Injustice (Which has been added since I 1st wrote this review. Still took them most of this year though.), you'll surely be disappointed.Helpful tip for closing apps on your Kindle Fire HDX:Some of you might not know how to close apps on your Kindle, and a number of pages on the web recommends force stopping apps to close them; however, that could damage the data. Assuming an app doesn't have an option to exit the app, just use the back button on the main screen of the app. If the app doesn't allow you to exit that way, then the developers never developed an exit button for their app. Then you'll have to force stop it to keep it from running in the background and avoid eating up some of that precious CPU usage. Hope that was helpful! It might've been common knowledge, but I would not know, as this is my 1st tablet ever, as mentioned previously.To use miracast for your Kindle Fire HDX and television, I recommend:NETGEAR Push2TV Wireless Display HDMI Adapter - Miracast and WiDi (PTV3000)B00904JILO
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 7" and Fire OS 3.1 review

Reviews.Author: Patriot1
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to the HDX for three reasons.  Better battery life, better screen resolution, and the ability to download prime videos.  I spend a lot of time in places where I cannot get phone or wifi signals.  Having the download option was really exciting.  I am very disappointed however.  Amazon has decided that feature only applies to old outdated movies, and NOT to all Prime movies.  Anything popular or created in the last ten years is NOT included.  If this option is one of your deciding factors, then don't.  The price really doesn't warrant upgrading from the Regular HD model which is a $100 cheaper.
Reviews.Title: Prime video download a joke

Reviews.Author: JenM
Reviews.Content: I preordered my Kindle Fire HDX and have been looking forward to receiving it. Over the weekend I started reading reviews and was dreading what I would see when I went to read a book.  I planned on using this as my main reader.  Well I received it yesterday and to my delight realized that the haze that has been discussed is not something that bothers me.  I honestly do not think I would have really noticed it had I not read about it.  The reading experience for me has been a crisp clear page with a wonderful backlit display.  No more book lights at night!  This replaces my Kindle keyboard.I am very pleased with my purchase and would recommend it to friends and family.
Reviews.Title: No issues with blue/purple haze

Reviews.Author: K. Kurtz "weary traveler"
Reviews.Content: My 2012 purchase of the Fire HD was one of my smartest purchases: as an e-reader, it excelled, and I'm a voracious reader. I had qualms about trading it in to purchase the new Fire HDX 7, but wanted the extended battery life offered.The HDX is beautiful, fast, and functions beyond expectations in all features, except, as an e-reader. I am very disappointed and am in conversation with tech support. First, the good: brilliant color, speed, much improved speakers, and the button placement is ideal for on/off and volume. "Mr. Hyde" appears in the reading, at least on my device, in a slowly-advancing glowing blue border! I know- the notice has gone out that this is "normal" and part of the advancement in true color display, but my device border is irregular, blotchy, and prevents any enjoyment of reading despite adjustments of brightness, font, etc.Amazon customer support is stellar, but I've had some difficulty conveying the fact that this display is unacceptable. Past experience with support has been very positive, so I won't let Jekyl and Hyde dissuade me.More to come....**10/30/13 Kindle support consented to sending a replacement. This second HDX does not have the unevenly lit border, but is "shadowy" even with the sepia background, which I find easier on the eyes. The HDX doesn't come close to the reading experience of the Fire HD that I traded in, but I'll live with this because any other e-readers I've tested have backlit displays that are far worse!I would advise you keep your Fire HDs if you enjoy reading. So, "Happy Halloween, Mr. Hyde!"***02/06/14 A major drawback has emerged: rebooting before connecting to wi-fi. Check the forum for this because scores of owners are waiting for a fix for this. The biggest disappointment has been the conflicting answers from Mayday and specialists for the fix. I am very persistent and have been issued several replacements- this latest delivered with the promise I would not have any problems. Unfortunately, it has not resolved.If Amazon would clarify whether this bug exists in software or hardware, many customers would be happy enough to await the fix!
Reviews.Title: Rebooting bug!

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've bounced around from tablet too tablet trying to find the best one. My first tablet was an iPad 1st gen. I liked it, but it was too restrictive & locked down. Since then I've owned the following: Google Nexus 7 (original), Amazon Kindle Fire (original), Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 7", Motorola Xoom (original), HP TouchPad (WebOS fire sale), PanDigital Novel 7, few generic Chinese eBay (all of which sucked BTW), Barnes & Nobel Nook HD+ (still have, gave it to my mom when I ordered the HDX) & now the just released Amazon Kindle Fire HDX 7" 32GB.Honestly I didn't know what too expect with the HDX, all the specs were awesome & it's kicking serious butt against the Nexus 7 (2013) in various benchmarks, but I was still kinda nervous. I knew the HDX would be high-quality & well made, Amazon doesn't put out anything, but well made devices.It arrived yesterday, it's a lot smaller than I thought it was going to be, but the difference is the HDX doesn't have all the wasted space usually found in the bezel areas of most tablets, it's minimalistic in design. Very much a welcomed change!By reducing the wasted bezel space, Amazon has not only made the tablet lighter, it's very easy to hold in one hand.The true full 1080p HD display has blown me away!!! I have never seen such clarity, vivid full spectrum extremely accurate color reproduction, flawless crisp clean & incredibly smooth video. Honestly, no matter what I say, this is one of those things you have too see to fully appreciate. There is no blurry, pixelated motion distortion you find in some HD TV's.Combined with true Dolby sound, which somehow manages too reproduce a very life like surround sound experience. I haven't figured out how the HDX pulls this off, but the sound is phenomenal.You definitely notice the quad-core Snapdragon 800 processor under the hood, as this thing flies!Amazon's re-built from the ground up newly minted Fire OS 3.0, is a work of art. It's fast, very user friendly, gorgeous graphics & integrates very smoothly with the content available from Amazon Prime. You can easily find anything & everything you may be looking for.Amazon's app store is rapidly catching up to Google Play & I have been able to find all the apps I use from the Google Play store.The integrated apps, such as e-mail, calendar etc. was surprisingly easy to setup with my Gmail & Google Calendar.Amazon has most definitely hit a massive homerun with the HDX line. Apple & Google have serious competition this time around.Don't second guess yourself if you are considering the HDX, it's an absolute no regret purchase. You will absolutely love the HDX. And YES, the HDX really does have the best & highest quality HD display currently available.After seeing what the Snapdragon 800 CPU & Adreno 330 GPU are capable of, I now see why Google is using both in the upcoming Nexus 5. I will definitely be buying one of those as soon as it's released as well!Awesome job Amazon!!!
Reviews.Title: Unbelievably beautiful HD, very fast, immersive & extremely high quality audio!!!

Reviews.Author: pixels rose "Pixels Rose"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 7 year old and it worked fine at first but now it keeps freezing up and we can't turn it off or anything it just freezes on whatever she was doing playing the music on and on can't even power it down until the battery dies wouldn't recommend this product.
Reviews.Title: Disappointing

Reviews.Author: Larry Sassaman
Reviews.Content: I purchased the HDX in early Dec. 2013 and until last week was very pleased with the Kindle's performance. Last week my HDX began shutting down and restarting for no reason and has continued to do so through the present. I've spoken to 3 different technical representatives about the problem and they have no solution to my dilemma in almost a week. All they can tell me is they're working on the problem. I've checked online forums and other people are reporting the same problem so this is not something which is unique to my Kindle. I expected a better response from Amazon. Update: It's now 2 weeks since I notified Amazon of the problem with my Kindle Fire HDX and they still have not offered any solution to the problem. When I called them 5 days ago for an update all they could tell me was that they were still studying the problem. Maybe they need an SOS button instead of just Mayday. Get with it Amazon !!!!!
Reviews.Title: Dissapointing technical support

Reviews.Author: John Pattenger
Reviews.Content: Second kindle HD ... first one didn't work properly...Now this one is messed up. Shuts itself down while I'm reading and reboots itself. Almost impossible to read in sunlight. You would think they would combine the best of previous kindles.
Reviews.Title: More trouble!!!!

Reviews.Author: kt "k"
Reviews.Content: I already have a Kindle Fire and bought the Fire HDX because it has a camera and allows me to skype (which the original Fire does not).  I love Kindle, however the HDX runs down the battery sooooo fast.  I went into the settings and had to look through many areas to find what was draining the battery. (It even drained when off completely).  I turned off a few settings and now the drain is slower.  However, this HDX is also much slower in downloading books, etc.  My original Fire can download a book in seconds, whereas this one takes many many minutes.  I'm not sure why.  I have to say if I only had one Kindle I would keep my original Fire and skip the HDX.  I don't see many advantages to it other than the camera and definitely many disadvantages.  I gave it a 3 star rating simply because the Kindle is a great thing to have, but I would give the original Fire a 5.
Reviews.Title: Not as good as original Kindle Fire

Reviews.Author: NV Blonde Shopper
Reviews.Content: This is a replacement for the original Kindle Fire.  It is a little wider that the original and does not fit in my small hand as well as the old one.  The physical volume control buttons are better than the original on screen volume controls.  The slanted back cover is a little hard to get used to.  I really loved my original Kindle Fire and this is not so much better or different that I would not have spent the money to get a new one if the other had not died after only 2 years and I just spent $79 to get the Prime subscription.  I just don't see that much difference in the screen quality or battery life.  If I had not had the original Kindle Fire perhaps I would be more impressed with the HDX. If this is your first Kindle Fire I am sure you will be pleased.  I purchased a case that has a cover with an automatic sleep and on feature when the cover is closed and opened and I like that. However, it does not charge when the cover is closed for some reason which is kind of annoying.
Reviews.Title: Good replacement for original Kindle Fire

Reviews.Author: wizardshat
Reviews.Content: A great tablet. Awesome resolution! Sound is accurate and loud. This little thing is FAST!!!!! I got my girlfriend a Kindle HD for XMAS and wanted to try the next level up. I will be getting her one of these for this XMAS and giving the regular one to our daughter.**Update**I have the Fire TV and the game controller for it. I haven't yet tried, but they say the game controller can connect to this too. SWEET! But, I have sent video back and forth between the HDX and the Fire TV. That is a great feature. Instead of pausing the television when I head to the kitchen for a snack, I can send it to the HDX where it picks up seamlessly. Then I carry the tablet to the kitchen and get what I want and then head back to the living room and send the video back to the Fire TV. I know this may sound lazy, but this is truly a cool feature. Combine this with being able to download some videos to the tablet to watch offline and this has to be the best set up available. I admit that I am an Amazon superfan. They have really done their research and made quality products. I highly reccomend all of them.
Reviews.Title: A VERY nice choice in the 7" market. Better than my Samsung.

Reviews.Author: Loves to Read
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet. It has alot of the capabilities of some of the other like iPad or the Samsung Galaxy. I'm able to watch movies- the color is amazing, I can surf, and get free e books from Amazon. The only downside is that either I can't personalize my homepage or I haven't figured out how yet. Easy to use. Great product for the price.
Reviews.Title: great tablet

Reviews.Author: Brady Baker
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in the fact that I purchased a kindle fire hdx for my newly retired mother to enjoy and it broke  while she was on vacation in florida. It was a Christmas  present .She called amazon and they tried to fix the issue and wasnt able so a new one was sent. She was told a new one would be sent along with a return shipping label. Well no label was sent so I had to find a friend with a printer, which was not easy. My only concern is sending the bad one back after so long. Thx for your concern.
Reviews.Title: disappointed

Reviews.Author: Pamela Janus
Reviews.Content: So sorry, but my KindleFire lasted long enough to get two books and a CD and then just stopped working. I am having it sent back to you.It's a shame because I was so excited with my son's Christmas present to me.Regards,Pamela Janus
Reviews.Title: KindleFire

Reviews.Author: debbie bakker
Reviews.Content: My kindle just died. I bought it for a Christmas gift for myself and it won't turn on any more.
Reviews.Title: distraught

Reviews.Author: M. A. Love "malove"
Reviews.Content: I bought this just a few weeks ago and LOVE it.  I had an Ipad that I got rid of because it drove me nuts.  Here's my comparison between the two:1.  It took me all of about 5 minutes to set the Kindle up, where as the Ipad too me much longer because I had to set up passwords, etc.  The Kindle connects directly to the Kindle account.2.  It's simple to download an app.  No passwords required.  The Ipad requires an Apple PW EVERY time you want to download an app, and you have to make sure you remember it EXACTLY, because if you don't, the system won't let you in, and there's no way to store your password so it will fill in automatically.  That's the major problem I had with it.3.  It has a faster processor than the Ipad.  Some apps on the Ipad took several minutes to download and the Kindle takes just seconds.4.  The screen is much brighter, and it responds better to my finger.  With the Ipad, I had to use a stylus.That's just a few of the things I like better on the Kindle.  I also won't need my Kindle reader anymore, and with the Fire, I'll have color with my books, at least on the covers.  I haven't tried downloading videos yet, but I will in the future.In short, I should have bought the Kindle instead of the Ipad.  It's a much better tablet for me.
Reviews.Title: Beats the Ipad hands down!

Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: I have had this for about a month and it doesn't hold the WI-fi signal. it shows as connected to the internet, but it drops out every few minutes. This problem evidently exists in about 5-10% of the units produced according to the forum amazon has about this specific problem. I routinely check the forums for a fix, but none have been provided, not even by amazon. I am slow to return the unit because I would actually love to use it and "sources" close to the problem were convinced that a patch would be available by Christmas time. Now, I am giving it another few weeks before my return deadline has expired, before I return it completely and move on to an Ipad or Surface. I have read that bigger screen units and regular Kindle Fire units don't have this problem, but I wouldn't consider staying with Kindle solely based on this bad experience. In the meantime some people, including amazon support, seem content with having to do a laundry list of homemade remedies in order to trick your kindle into working for 5 minutes. Its like having a luxury cadillac with a hole in the gas tank, pretty...but useless. I would prefer that something I paid that much money for just worked on its own. I guess im just old fashion that way.
Reviews.Title: "wi-fi only" doesnt hold a wi-fi signal...pretty annoying.

Reviews.Author: M. Cordoba "mxc"
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like the kindle. It has a great price, awesome screen, and with an advertised 11 hour battery life (up to 17 hour if just reading according to Amazon) I figured this device was the perfect companion.After a few weeks of testing and timing, I can confidently say that for the vast majority of user scenarios, the battery life is significantly worse. In fact, I have no idea how exactly Amazon came up with the 11 hour number.But lets start with the basics pros:- Screen is really nice (yes there is some slight blue light bleed around the edges, but Amazon has a complete explanation of why that is - and it's used to have the great color accuracy/gamut that the display has). Honestly, it was very little to bother me at all, and welcome the increase color gamut. The screen is superb.- Kindle Free Time: this is absolutely great. I can let my daughter play with the kindle with some serious restrictions. (what apps can be accessed, how long she can play, read or watch videos (3 distinct timers). She can't do purchases or anything else. I can't believe nobody had done something like this before. It's really amazing.Cons- Neutered android means that a lot of very popular android apps are not available, and you have to resort to side loading them, and not all work that well. I really wish they allowed a larger percentage of the Google Play store apps (all preferred)- thick border around the edges, where the display could be extended to be even more usable without increasing the size of the device. It's around a 1.5 inch diagonal of wasted space. The iPad min in contrast his just a 1/4 of an inch or so.- And the worst offender which causes this to be a 2 star product instead of 4 stars, is the misrepresented battery life. Partner has an iPad2, (10 hour claim) and it generally lives to those expectations, lasts all day off the plug, great.The Real Battery Life of the HDX which claims to be 11 hours (up to 17 reading!!) is closer to 5 hours.Here are the tests I did during the last 3 weeks:The first day, I downloaded several apps and got it setup, read some books to my daughter, and watched a movie. I used the mayday button to ask about sorting apps by age of your child (can't be done as of now). It couldn't have been more than 4 hours, and the device was already at 10% charge (down from a full 100% charge) so I was really disappointed, and started doing a series of tests:Things to note:* Wifi only model (3g would suck the battery even more)* brightness was set to 50%.* I'm a huge fan of Amazon, and this is the first Amazon product that has really let me down with their claims. I owned a kindle keyboard, and now a paperwhite 2 - both of which I love. Customer service has always been second to none. Basically, there is no reason for me to "bash" this product. I am a tech person, and I am aware battery life varies quite a bit by usage, but this is a serious issue not just a small variation. Amazon failed to deliver big time on their battery life promise.Test 1:* 3 hours of mostly reading (kids books, so they had colors and things, my daughter flipping through the pages)* 1 hour of videos (she was unfortunately drawn to Barney)* Half hour of games (some simple puzzle games, nothing 3D intensive or anything requiring full use of the graphic processor)* Battery was down to 20% and I started surfing the web and others until it ran down in 1.75 hours.So basically, during a reading heavy session (17 hour amazon claim), the device failed to last 6 hours.Test 2:- Charged it overnight, let my daughter do whatever she wanted with it (using the awesome Kindle Free Time). She mostly watched videos and flipped through some books. She also opened a game or two (Again simple puzzle games, no 3D battery intensive games). She had breakfast in between and then lunch. And then brought the device to me because the battery was dead. The device lasted just over 4 hours...In contrast the iPad, where she likes to play with 3D puzzles and several other 3D apps (Mr Potato), she plays with it several days before it ever runs down.  I can confidently say that playing with apps, the iPad lasts at least twice as long as the kindle fire.Test 3:- Sporadic use throughout he day. I figure I'd try a really subtle scenario.- Light web browsing (not more than 30 minutes)- Some videos (1.5 hours)- occasional book (only 5 minute spans, or flipping through pictures)- The device was on the sleep state most of the time.- Battery life was at 30% that night. So 70% of the battery was lost during some 3 maybe 4 hours of use.I will do a strictly video test and post it later.But nothing I have seen indicates that any normal usage will get you anywhere near the 11 hour claim.
Reviews.Title: Terrible Battery Life (5 hours or so)

Reviews.Author: P. Minners
Reviews.Content: I have owned an original Kindle for sometime now and I bought the Kindle Fire for my mom.  My original kindle is nice and light while the Fire was very heavy. I have wanted an IPad but the price was out of my range so I decided to invest in the new Kindle Fire HDX.  Well I'm pleased to say that I absolutely love it.  All my books uploaded from the Cloud, and I was able to upload all my pictures and music from my IPhone as well.  I love the fact that I can have an Office Suite to type letters and presentations.  The IPad does not have that capability, I believe.  It's lighter than the original Fire; however reading in sunlight is still a problem with all tablets. I have my original Kindle synced up so I can just take that outside with me.  There are some apps on my IPhone; such as an Optimum app or the Watch ABC app, that I would like on the Kindle, but I understand they are working on that.
Reviews.Title: Love It

Reviews.Author: Mieko*
Reviews.Content: I can give you a 3 letter word for this Kindle HDX 7" 32 gb tablet!!!!WOW !!!I have a basic Kindle for reading outside..don't need that anymore.I have a Kindle Fire First Gen.  I love it so much, and will keep it so my husband (who has his own KF and account) can read my books as well as his.My new (shiny shiny) KF HDX 7" 32 GB came today..earlier than they had estimated.  Thank you Amazon!The UPS man put it between my screen & front doors for safety.  Thank you UPS.I won't say I put it through tests...but I thank those who did and posted their reviews.I set it up...well that took 10 minutes.  It is so intuitive!  No problem getting on my WiFi.  Took me a few moments to find all the settings but I learn as I go.All my books were there (well I didn't count all 1200 lol).  I keep most in the cloud and there they were.  All my games & apps were there and to my delight, my Words with Friends hooked up to my account and my current game with my daughter in law was there!  I hadn't expected that.In fact, in regard to the pale blue/purple line around the outside of the screen..I like it!!  It looks so nice surrounding the book content. I was looking for it so I did notice it, but it sure is not ugly or a deterrent to reading.I haven't had time to read in the sunshine yet, but even if I freeze my bottom off...I will tomorrow!!!**Note: Though I cannot read in bright sunlight (wouldn't anyway)I can sit on my front porch or my patio and read just fine. I will try it in the car next.I set up my HBOtoGo, Netflix and other movie apps in moments.  You just click on all of them and they download in the order that you chose them.I couldn't even take a nap today..I was so excited and happy.One of my favorite things ever has been my first gen. Kindle Fire. My husband and I gifted each other with them 2 years ago, and they really make us happy.  We are avid readers and can download books at anytime and read them immediately..or later if we want.**Nuther Note: My husband ordered HIS Kindle Fire HDX 7" 32 gb today. He saw my excitement and joy over it and had to have one too. And though we aren't rich, we decided these are Xmas gifts from and to each other.Two of my sons called today and asked if my tablet arrived and were delighted at my descriptions of it. Both are firemen in different states. One uses a laptop at work and a Nook. One uses a mini IPad at work. They have probably ordered their KF HDXs by now..and then there are the wives.  See how this spreads? :)My review is basically to say that the new Kindle Fire HDX 7" is a wonderful device, very easy to set up and use..gorgeous screen, great looking device (love the back :) )  We checked out 'Game of Thrones' on HBOToGo and the sound is lovely..the picture is amazing.I recommend this Tablet highly!!! Five Stars Highly. :)
Reviews.Title: What a wonderful tablet!!!!

Reviews.Author: Kathleen Lambert
Reviews.Content: We recently purchased two Kindle Fires, an HD for my daughter and an HDX for myself--primarily for work. Both devices are extremely well designed. I can compare them to a Galaxy Tab 7" and they come out far ahead, particularly that Amazon has realized the "natural" position for a 7" tablet is horizontal, not vertical. The screen is amazing, which you'd expect from the stats, but for a tiny 7" device, the speakers are actually quite capable. Sadly the HDX seems to have some hardware issues.The first thing I noticed was it frequently wouldn't connect to Wifi. I had the same issue on the wifi at work and at a third location. We also have several other devices, including the previously mentioned Kindle Fire HD, that don't have the issue. I decided to google the problem and found dozens of threads with similar experiences, including people who'd returned the device and had a replacement with the same behavior.The second problem I had was that the battery would drop as much as 50% overnight when left in sleep mode. That's just not acceptable to me. Again, we had the Fire HD to compare it to and the battery drop there was only a few percent. I tried deleting applications that might be activating the device while it was asleep, a factory reset, but nothing worked. Again, I found threads on the Kindle support forums with dozens of people experiencing the same issue, including those who got replacement units.I'd suggest just buying an HD, which is what I'll be doing the next time they go on sale. They're both great devices and the HD doesn't seem to have these issues.
Reviews.Title: Wifi Disconnects & Battery Drains

Reviews.Author: Cristiano
Reviews.Content: I got the Kindle Fire HDX 7" (32GB) for my wife as a belated surprise birthday gift and she absolutely loves it! We've had Amazon Prime for awhile and we now get to maximize the value of Prime membership as the Kindle Fire allows us to access the growing selection of free movie/TV content!I'm a bit of techie and my experiences with tablets have been quite ambivalent. Here's my history:- Amazon Kindle DX (hated it b/c it was too slow, clunky; sold it on craigslist after 3 months)- Apple iPad 2nd gen (loved it at first but when I tried to use for productivity, it was horrible; sold on craigslist after 6 months)- Apple iPad mini (after playing with it at a store, I didn't feel it was worth it so when I got it as a gift I immediately sold it on craigslist and got the Canon S90 camera instead)Despite this disappointment with tablets, I thought the Kindle HDX was a good value at its price point and would make a great gift for my wife. So I pulled the trigger and let me tell you, my wife is so happy (I'm a bit tempted to get one for myself). The screen is crisp and rich in colors, the OS is fast, form factor is perfect for personal viewing, super light (very important when watching a 2 hr movie), all previous electronic Kindle books look great on it, and the chambray cover I bought for her looks great. Also Amazon Prime membership makes the Kindle HDX have so much more value than the more expensive Apple iPads. We live in Korea and travel a lot so my wife is looking forward to using her new Kindle HDX on long transcontinental flights (now that they allow you to downloads some of the content).In order to lift the geolocation restrictions, we purchased witopia VPN ($50/yr) and setup the IPSec protocol. It was simple and worked right away at HD streaming quality! Hope this helps someone! A great gift!
Reviews.Title: Great for those who travel often and live overseas!

Reviews.Author: JTL
Reviews.Content: The integration into the Amazon ecosphere is great. All my books, etc right there. But I let my Prime subscription lapse and never renewed it, so the rest of that content isn't so useful. I'm also not a big consumer of media on tablets, so watching video isn't super important to me here. When it comes to using this tablet for work applications, well, don't bother.I'm a writer. I like to have my tablet around for writing and none of the apps I use for writing are supported here. Not Scrivener, not Dropbox. Well, Evernote is supported, so there's that. But it's clear that the Kindle Fire HDX isn't built for work. It's a media consumption device almost exclusively. It's great at that. But then again, so is the iPad Mini and that's what I've ended up going with because it does all the stuff I need it to do very well.No device is perfect and I really do think the Kindle Fire HDX is a nice piece of gear. It has its place in the tablet ecosphere, just not, unfortunately, on my night stand.
Reviews.Title: Good tablet for reading, not so great for other stuff

Reviews.Author: V. White
Reviews.Content: I love my HDX 7! Amazon prime makes if even more fun and I am going to finally give in and pay the annual after the free trial is over. Something I was against.The shows and movies look great on HD it makes downtime go by fast and I lie that I am download the shows instead of using wifi to stream. I wish I would have purchase more space but 16gb works if I delete shows as I finish I believe I fit 10 to 12 shows at a time.The blue does not bother me which was my concern. The kindle reading to me is great I use it on my drives home from work and sometimes at the office. I was never an audio book fan but I like this option without spending audiobook money.The ads only come up on the lock screen and usually for free or cheap stuff so that is great. I got a $3 music credit o. One of the ads which is nice.I have not read in the sun yet but the sun in my corner office has not effected my reading or show watching during lunch hour.Battery life has been great!This was my birthday gift and I am so happy. I was considering N iPad mini and I have used many of my friends and I love the HDX more. I like free shows and movies .I only was able to get wifi at home so far so I can't comment on that but setting that up was easy.This is a great buy in all honesty! I am truly happy!
Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire HDX 7

Reviews.Author: Paul Alsip
Reviews.Content: I had my Kindle Fire HDX for literally about 2 weeks. I purchased no insurance because I have found they are normally a waste of money on items of this price. The deductible is usually as expensive as buying a new one.Anyway, the kindle itself was pretty great for apps and such. However, ****BE WARNED**** it is not very durable. It fell off my couch about 12 niches give or take on to a "CARPETED" floor and the screen shattered! lol Nothing wrong with the inside but once the screen crack the touch screen stopped working properly.I have owned quite a few tablets in my life and I have NEVER seen one break this easily. They have offered to send me some older model refurbished kindle in exchange for about a $100 fee. (Older Model) keep in mind. Apparently Amazon (Kindle) department only offers a warranty on inner parts in such cases something mechanical goes wrong. (No Screen Protection).Do your homework before selecting this product. I believe some places like Samsung Galaxy have a screen protection program they do. Amazon really should offer a better broken screen replacement program or at least let people send them in to get the screen replaced on theirs at a low price vs having to replace it at $149 just so they can turn around and resell yours at a $129 profit.Kinda sad program they have currently.Anyway..................I would suggest looking into other that are much more durable. Much better replacement plans, and even cheaper all around for a new one with better specifications.Product usage gets 4 StarsProduct durability 1 StarCustomer Service 2 Stars.
Reviews.Title: Impossible to repair.

Reviews.Author: Abdullah Albyati
Reviews.Content: There is no need for introductions. Amazon is introducing high quality products to the market, and Amazon is doing great.The 7" Kindle Fire HDX is well designed, and has an amazing feel to it when you hold it in the first time.What do I like about Amazon 7" Kindle Fire HDX?Light weight tablet. it is only 10.7 oz (303 grams) for the WIFI version, and 11.0 oz (311 grams) for the 4G.The Kindle fire HDX screen resolution is beyond HD, it is HDX which means you get bright quality from any angle. I have used many tablets, but when I used the Kindle Fire HDX I was stunned by the screen quality.Elegant design that gives the tablet a luxurious feel.The Kindle Fire HDX has a great sound quality provided by 2 speakers located on the top. Really the best sound quality I heard in a 7" tablet.What I hate about?When it comes to gadgets it is a love hate relationship. There is always I wish my device has this or that.So what do I wish the to change or add to the Amazon 7" Kindle Fire HDX?External SD card support. 16G is not much now a days (although there is 32G version of it) so I wish it had an external slot for Micro SD card for extra storage.Other than that there is nothing else I would change in the Kindle Fire HDX.
Reviews.Title: My favorite 7" tablet so far!!!

Reviews.Author: Tito E. Dutari M.
Reviews.Content: I am an Amazon Prime member for many years now and though, as many others I guess, that the instant video and books did work with my membership as well. But no.The advertising should and ought to mention that little simple but essential fact; so it is in fact misleading (not anything else).As regards to books, only one (1) book could be borrowed per month; but in the advertising says that "hundred of thousands" of books are available for you. Does it sounds familiar?You do sacrifice full flexibility and info and apps access to become a captive "client" of Amazon's environment and marketplace, but are indeed not treated in a discriminatory manner, since you can buy everything but you don't get all that is advertised.The aforementioned is, definitively, not in line with Amazon's reputation and prestige.  The company must do something about it.
Reviews.Title: Don't buy unless you live in the US!!

Reviews.Author: RMG
Reviews.Content: I purchased the new kindle fire HDX in December.  It has been acting up since...turning off while reading books and listening to music, flickering and adding the toolbar border, when I do not ask for it.  Customer service said they would send me a new one.  They sent an old refurbished one.  I called customer service again.  They said they would send me a NEW one.  The next one came in an old refurbished one again.  This one came in and still had fingerprints from whoever worked on it.  REALLY???I was told by Alicia A. that it is their policy to send you used kindles as replacement.  REALLY?If I wanted a used Kindle, I would have purchased a used Kindle.  This is my second one, but I will not be buying another.JUST A THOUGHT...Maybe they could at least appear like they were sending something new.
Reviews.Title: Hope Your Kindle Happens To Work!

Reviews.Author: biologytyler "The Biology Expert"
Reviews.Content: I have several different tablets such as a galaxy tab 7 inch and an galaxy tab 10.1 inch. But so far this tablet has blown all the others away especially when it comes to the display. This tablet also excels in its ability to open apps quickly and efficiently. The 2.2 quad core processor really shows its power in this tablet as webpages load lightning fast and he apps like candy crush are smooth with no lag whatsoever. You also have access to all of your cloud content such as your Amazon prime music and your Amazon prime video library. The speakers on this unit is something I must talk about they are the best I have ever seen on any tablet ever. Even though this is a 7 inch tablet the speakers sound like those found on 10 inch or higher tablet they are exceptional and have yet to be beat. Others have commented on a blue haze around the borders of white pages it is a little noticeable but it is nothing to be worried about as it is very faint and easily overlooked. Overall I give this tablet a 10/10 and it's very fast has a brilliant display good color good picture quality great speakers great charge times great battery life everything is great about it if you're looking for a tablet this is the one to get. 100% recommend.
Reviews.Title: best 7 inch tablet on the market.

Reviews.Author: Christian Haldeman
Reviews.Content: Purchased this as a gift for our child.  Spent a week setting it up (parental controls, purchased apps, downloaded videos, books, games,...).  Tablet began struggling to stay connected.  We run two smartphones with a matching brand tablet and a PC based laptop off of our cable providers WiFi router.  We can, have and do run all machines' browsers at once.  However, this tablet would not run the browser.  When looking at the connection and settings on the tablet, it said the signal strength was good (would also read maximum number of bars at top) however it would spin and say "loading" for as long as we would let it go.  Spoke with Amazon as well as Kindle specialists.  Over a series of lost Mayday sessions (lost connection), phone conversations, clearing device in multiple ways (then reconfiguring), rebooting router and shutting down all other connections to phones, tablets and laptops....nothing changed.  The final answer I was given was that the router we have does not have the capacity to supply enough bandwidth to support the Kindle's browser.  Not sure I believe it, but I will go back to a brand I know my router can support.Too bad.  I was impressed with the interface, video quality and options for apps and downloads.  Was also curious to see how well it ran Office....was considering one for work as the price would have beaten the Surface.Techs were friendly and really tried to help as best they could.
Reviews.Title: Serious connectivity issues with little help to resolve

Reviews.Author: Loralyn Hamilton "Ula"
Reviews.Content: I have a 1st gen mini iPad and my Kindle far exceeds the mini iPad in many areas.  Screen is beautiful - it's much easier to read.  The icons are more colorful and dynamic.  The only downfall is that Amazon doesn't allow you to use Google Play through the Kindle and a few of the apps we enjoy (like Dominoes by Flyclops) are only through Google play and Apple - hoping this is offered soon.  I can do everything on my Kindle that I can on my mini iPad (there are even free texting apps). Documents are PC friendly instead of trying to convert Pages (Apple) to Word etc. and they didn't try to sell me a data plan so basically I can use it anywhere there is free wifi (I know I can do this with iPad as well but was told I had to have a data plan.)  It's a great product!
Reviews.Title: I love the Kindle Fire HDX!

Reviews.Author: H. A. Brown
Reviews.Content: I bought the kindle HDX 7, WI-FI, 64 gb with mixed feelings after reading all the reviews.  Now that I have it, I don't understand people's issues with the blue around the frame that they claim to see and find so annoying.  I have no such problems and find it a joy to read. whether in the dark or the sun-I have no problems with this issue or reading.  I love the color and responsiveness of it and it's lightweight and hand size make it so easy to carry or put in my purse even with a case.  Thank you for another great product.
Reviews.Title: Just the right size

Reviews.Author: Debra Lewis
Reviews.Content: It is not even a month old and it keeps freezing up I had to call help 3 times already.
Reviews.Title: Freezing up

Reviews.Author: Kevin Morley
Reviews.Content: While many people have been complaining that this tablet is not as good as a Droid or an IPad. I think they miss the point.I also think they are sheep. The Kindle Fire HDX does it's job very well. If you want a portable computer, buy a frigging laptop. These are tablets. Get over it!
Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet

Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love mine. I wouldn't of asked for it, but I'm active military and deploying soon. But any-who. The Kindle Fire HDX 7" keeps to the size of a traditional book unlike the 8.9". Now that I have the 7 I honestly don't believe I'd like holding the 8.9 version to read.The HDX version does provide over-all flexibility as if you were almost on your laptop. All color of course. Basic web browsing functions: yahoo, gmail, etc.., video from youtube. And you can download most apps. Pinterest, twitter, Pandora... I haven't tried games yet so i'm not sure how well they work.I can tell you that with the 16GB Kindle, you can fit 2,000+ books, PLUS a other files and still have 7 to 7.5GB of free space left.  Plus multiple back light features for reading and other accessibility.I did read only one other review from a person about Battery life..... He was comparing/rating what he called heavy HD video use/streaming. if you are buying a Kindle, please keep in mind it's intended use.I wanted mine for reading and small amounts of web use... Not gaming and HD video's.Overall, The kindle HDX 7 is the perfect fit for me. I am able to store/take photo's, music, and read comfortably for as long as my eyes can take it, which to say is only a few hours. And the battery isn't below 85%-ish. However, I would recommend using a USB wall charger vs the one that comes with the device. The charger that comes with it does not provide fast charge times comparatively.Hope my review has somewhat helped.
Reviews.Title: Awesome Device to have on the go for reading

Reviews.Author: Mr. Onyok J. Bentot "OJB"
Reviews.Content: Unstable OS but brilliant execution as an Entertainment Tablet. Fantastic display!I purchased this tablet over a week ago and was extremely impressed with its ease of use and astounded by the wealth of content available as Prime Member. I streamed movies and read books and downloaded games to my heart's content. But alas, the tablet began freezing (blank black screen) frequently and inexplicably. I did not know how to "kill" apps easily like ok n an iPad or Android tablet.I am extremely disappointed even as I write this review on the tablet itself. I moved from an old iPad to this one and for a week or so I thought I'd hit the jackpot because of all the free content and books especially. Perhaps others may have a better experience with the device itself. But as an entertainment tablet, it does not get any better.
Reviews.Title: Brilliant Execution as an Entertainment Tablet, but has stability issues.

Reviews.Author: P. Castronovo
Reviews.Content: This tablet does everything I need.  Web surfing is easy and the readable pane feature is great for reading news. Downloading books and movies straight from Amazon is simple and quick. I've also enjoyed the games on the app store.  My wife converted from an iPad based on my experience. At 7", it is truly portable. Larger sizes are just too bulky for travel. Get it.
Reviews.Title: A tablet that is truly portable

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I was concerned when I bought my HDX that I wouldn't be able to install most of the apps I was used to on my Nexus10 but I found 1Mobile Market on cnet's download site and it let me install most of the apps I was missing.  Including chrome, google maps, google earth, google translate, chromecast, AVG, Task Manager, copilot and more. all work great so far.
Reviews.Title: apps available for Kindle Fire at 1Mobile Market

Reviews.Author: Jimmy L. Wilbanks
Reviews.Content: I have never owned a Kindle previously so I had to get acclimated to how it works in general.I also bought a Netgear PTV3000 so I could fling the content to my tv and it works GREAT! I searched to find the right box and found out the Netgear PTV3000 is the only one certified by Kindle to do it. I plugged it into my HDMI input on my Samsun plasma tv, found the connection procedures and shot the display over to my tv, after about 30 seconds or so it connects and everything works perfectly! I have a couple of little complaints about the Kindle in general. When I download movies to watch when I am not in Wifi mode, it takes a REALLY long time to download and if you try to download them in full 1080p, it takes even longer. I have settled for 720p on most movies but still takes a while. Also, when I fling movies to the tv, it does show in HD but there is fairly obvious pixelization so it is not as good as watching a Blu Ray disc. It also cuts out just a little bit every now and then but no big issues there. I got my email synced to the Kindle and that works fine. I also ordered Amazon Prime so I could watch free movies and tv shows but I would say less than half of them are actually free, which is pretty annoying. I will not pay $2 or $3 bucks to watch an older tv show when the reruns are free on tv. It would be nice if they had an option to watch them free with commercials or to pay for them. The same for older movies, we were going t Ho watch some older Christmas movies this year and several of them were not on HD Prime so you have to pay for a lot of older movies too. I am still getting to learn all the modes and I have not played any games yet so can't really reply to those. I do wish I had spent a few more bucks on the Kindle with the larger memory though, if you download a few movies, they will eat your storage space right up. Hope these comments help anyone considering this. Also, I went with the 7" Kindle instead of the 8.9" because I just could not justify paying almost $200 extra bucks for just 2 inches of extra screen when everything else seemed the same. I am quite happy with the 7" screen as I use it on my train rides to and from work and I think the bigger one would be more cumbersome. Plus when I use it at home, I can fling it to the big screen.
Reviews.Title: So far the new Kindle HDX 7 is awesome!

Reviews.Author: Thomas Didymus "Old Duck"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE (01/03/2014) - My third replacement HDX arrived yesterday, and the white of the screen still has a yellow tint to it, but at least this tint is relatively consistent. It does appear to be just slightly more yellow on the right than the left, but it's not blotchy / spotty like the HDX it's replacing. I did an experiment to verify that I'm not imagining this tint - I set the Kindle overlapping my Macbook laptop screen, and side-by-side the difference in white is quite noticeable. However, since the tint is consistent and not blotchy, it doesn't take long for my brain to "tune out" the yellowness and accept the white as white while reading. I'm updating my rating from 2 stars to 3 stars. I'd give it 4 stars, because I like the tablet as a whole, except that it took me three tries to obtain a Kindle HDX with a "tolerable" screen (I'll be keeping this latest Kindle). If you were to put all three HDXs I've used side-by-side, each screen would be noticeably different than the other when reading text on a white background. That just should not be the case.-- ORIGINAL REVIEW --I would give the Kindle Fire HDX four or five stars if not for the problems I've had with the screen. I'm on my second HDX and have just requested my third. My first HDX had something akin to "dead pixels" - a brown spot under the glass that looked like someone focused the sun on that spot with a magnifying glass. I returned that device immediately, only to get a replacement with a different but even more distracting screen defect that I can best describe as "muddiness."I've owned a variety of laptops and tablets over the years, including the previous Kindle HD, and I've never encountered a screen that looks like you're viewing it through a thin layer of dirty water. The uneven "dirty" white is mostly noticeable when reading black text on a white background - which is most of the time when using the browser, news apps, or even just reading a Kindle book.When I noticed this right away on the new HDX, I remembered the story of iPhones having a similar problem due to a screen adhesive that takes time to dry, so I kept my current tablet for close to a month, using it every day with the hope that this muddiness would go away on its own. It has not. It is HIGHLY distracting, and despite the crisper resolution, I find myself wanting to return to my old Kindle HD. I've requested a third HDX to replace this, but how many of these tablets must I go through to find one with even a decent display?Just in case you think I'm fussy, I have no problem with the blue glow on the sides.
